channel.title: Flash --> Java
channel.description:
I don't know if you've ever played it or not (if not, you've probably seen the ads), but Evony is a game coded in flash... Not going into detail..
For those of you who know the basis of the game I am talking about, would it be possible to create such a game in Java?
If it is, I would like to give it a try. :) But, I fail too much to code something like that. (GUI IS A BITCH!)

item.title: Flash --> Java
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:30, topic:375727”][quote author=Saphire` link=topic=471656.msg3463117#msg3463117 date=1294691502]
You obviously haven’t read into runescape related things. The server uses runescript, although the client is still run through java.
[/quote]“Runescript” is just how Andrew Gower termed what is referred to as their content-development scripting language. They do use Java (both server and client sided) but simply have a virtual machine (again, written in Java) that interprets the scripting. The client also uses Runescript, just so you know.[/quote]

I was just going by the news articles they posted. Obviously it was dumbed down for the public, but thanks for the clarification

Read full topic

Saphire`:

You obviously haven’t read into runescape related things. The server uses runescript, although the client is still run through java.

The engine is still in Java, and it does something with the scripts. IIRC it “turns them into Java”

item.title: Flash --> Java
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Saphire`, post:26, topic:375727”][quote author=Lin link=topic=471656.msg3449737#msg3449737 date=1293664868]
“but Evony is a game coded in flash…” which is why it sucks. A lot. And obviously, a game like it is possible in Java. You’ve seen RuneScape, haven’t you?
[/quote]
Runescape had to move from java to their own language because java ain’t powerful enough.[/quote]

No? RuneScript is what they use for ease of content development. The game server and client are still in Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Flash --> Java
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:2, topic:375779"][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=471656.msg3455146#msg3455146 date=1293995920]

Flash is easily hackable. Java is much harder.

cheat engine can intersect INT pretty easy, so java can be easy to hack also. Well depending on who created the java game

That is why you have to store all INTs on the server side, and make it update only on the server side. Making it so the client cannot affect it, only the way it is viewed.

[/quote]

and why did you capitalize every letter in the abbreviation ‘int’?[/quote]
Does it really matter why?

Read full topic

item.title: Flash --> Java
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“sniffle6, post:17, topic:375727”][quote author=Muroth link=topic=471656.msg3450165#msg3450165 date=1293683741]
Flash is easily hackable. Java is much harder.
[/quote]

cheat engine can intersect INT pretty easy, so java can be easy to hack also. Well depending on who created the java game[/quote]

That is why you have to store all INTs on the server side, and make it update only on the server side. Making it so the client cannot affect it, only the way it is viewed.

Also: I’m pretty sure that Cheat Engine cannot intercept longs or doubles.

Read full topic

item.title: Flash --> Java
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:11, topic:375727”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=471656.msg3450115#msg3450115 date=1293680554]
War of Legends…

Forgot about that game. Jagex DID release it, and it is a mirror image of Evony, but it is programmed in Flash.

@Davidi: The game has some basic animations. Most of it is sprites, however. The animations could be possible to create in GIF’s?
[/quote]Chances are they are gifs.[/quote]No. Chances in fact are that they don’t use GIFs, as only clueless fucktards like yourself would see that option as a feasible one. GIFs are (usually) updated asynchronously by whatever rendering library in use and therefore would not be at par with the actual game frame rate and would thus make the entire “animation” crap look like unsynchronized shit.

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:14, topic:375727”][quote author=Muroth link=topic=471656.msg3450165#msg3450165 date=1293683741]
Flash is easily hackable. Java is much harder.
[/quote]

Easily hackable, yes…
The one problem I’ll have if I make this is that people will be able to hack the client, just like they did to Runescape…
They’ll make private servers, and I’ll lose players >.>[/quote]
If by “easily hackable” you mean easily reversed engineered, then both are equally easy. Both are compiled to bytecode that is to be interpreted by its own virtual machine and is thus a much higher-level representation of the same code represented in, say, disassembled machine code (assembly).

Read full topic

item.title: Flash --> Java
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:14, topic:375727”]Easily hackable, yes…
The one problem I’ll have if I make this is that people will be able to hack the client, just like they did to Runescape…
They’ll make private servers, and I’ll lose players >.>[/quote]

Nothing you make will become popular enough or be good enough for people to actually want to spend the time to do anything to it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Explisionist wrote:

I have not played the game although I have seen some of the game play its okay.

Have you seen AQ, DF, MQ? They are all 2D I am not to sure if its flash or not, if anyone knows.

But there are bases out there like the ones those are based off of that you could use as a start up and you can actually find one thats really good and allows you to make your own stuff in paint, etc… You can add actual pictures and then you can model it to the 2D body’s.

If I can find the name of it I will pm it to you.
